topic.shortdesc: Rampia and Prince Charming wander in the wilderness.

body.p: Rampia wandered in the woods for a very long time. Her hair grew out again, now brushing her back, and she wore it tied up in a knot. She lived on her own in the wilderness, just happy to be free despite the difficulties. She loved sleeping in hollow trees at night and foraging for berries during the day. She lived on her own in the wilderness, fighting for survival against animals and the elements. She hid in hollow trees at night, and spent her days hoping the berries she picked were not poisonous. She looked for her prince as she traveled, but she could not find him.

After a while, Rampia encountered a new blessing. curse. She gave birth to a pair of beautiful twins, a boy and a girl. The boy had the prince's dark curls, while the girl's hair was golden like hers. She wished even more to find Prince Charming now, so that he could meet his children. she would not be alone. The three of them continued to wander, trying to find any place to stay.

The prince also wandered, forlorn and wishing to see his love. blind and helpless. He longed to find his way back to the tower and to Rampia, but he could not find his way. His face was burned by the sun, his dark hair dirtier than it had ever been.

One day, Rampia found her way back to the tower. She blinked in disbelief, amazed to see it again. It held good memories for her, despite what she now knew about the woman who had claimed to be her mother. In the distance, she saw a figure drawing nearer, and she knew in an instant that it was her prince. Rampia began to run.
